text: The 2019 Asian Men's Club Volleyball Championship will be the tenth edition of the Asian Men's Club Volleyball Championship, an annual international volleyball club tournament organised by the Asian Volleyball Confederation (AVC) with Chinese Taipei Volleyball Association (CTVA). The tournament was held in Taipei, Chinese Taipei, from 18 to 26 April 2019. The winner of this tournament will be qualified to 2019 FIVB Volleyball Men's Club World Championship. ==Qualification== Following the AVC regulations, The maximum of 16 teams in all AVC events will be selected by * 1 team for the organizer * 10 teams based on the rankings of the previous championship * 5 teams from each of 5 zones (with a qualification tournament if needed) ===Qualified associations=== {| class="wikitable" width=900 |- !width=25%|Means of qualification !width=27%|Date!!width=20%|Venue!!width=6%|Vacancies!!width=22%|Qualified |- |Host Country||||||style="text-align:center;"|1|| Chinese Taipei |- |2018 Asian Championship||30 July–6 August 2018|| Naypyidaw||style="text- align:center;"|9|| Iran Kazakhstan Vietnam Japan Thailand Sri Lanka Australia Hong Kong Turkmenistan |- |CAZVA representatives ||rowspan=3|2 February 2019||rowspan=3| Bangkok||style="text-align:center;"|1|| India |- |SEAZVA representatives ||style="text-align:center;"|2|| Indonesia Singapore |- |WAZVA representatives ||style="text-align:center;"|3|| ~~Iraq~~ ~~Kuwait~~ Qatar |- !colspan="3"|Total!!16!! |} ===Qualified teams=== The following teams qualified for the tournament.
